articles.author: Andrew Goudsward, Sarah N. Lynch
articles.description: Donald Trump was hit by a new federal indictment on Tuesday in his bid to overturn his 2020 election defeat, with prosecutors narrowing their approach after a U.S. Supreme Court ruling that former presidents have broad immunity form criminal prosecution.
articles.title: Donald Trump faces revised US indictment in election subversion case

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Tuesday that the war with Russia would eventually end in dialogue, but that Kyiv had to be in a strong position and that he would present a plan to U.S. President Joe Biden and his two potential successors.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy to present plan to Biden to end war with Russia

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Palestinians displaced by fighting in the Gaza Strip crowded onto the seashore as Israeli forces continued to battle Hamas fighters in central and southern areas, with health officials reporting at least 17 people killed in strikes on Tuesday.
articles.title: Israel battles Hamas in Gaza as space for displaced families narrows

articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: Donald Trump's advantage over Kamala Harris on the economy and crime is eroding among U.S. voters, a sign the Democratic vice president's campaign is gathering momentum ahead of the Nov. 5 presidential election, according to a new Reuters/Ipsos poll.
articles.title: Trump's edge over Harris on economy, crime slips, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched several waves of missile and drone attacks overnight targeting Kyiv and other regions, Ukraine's military said early on Tuesday, a day after Moscow's biggest such attack of the war.
articles.title: Russia pounds Ukraine with missiles, drones for second day in row, Kyiv says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States remains committed to defending Israel in the event of an Iranian attack, White House national security spokesperson John Kirby said on Tuesday.
articles.title: White House's Kirby says US would defend Israel in Iranian attack

articles.author: Jennifer Rigby, Julie Steenhuysen
articles.description: Scientists studying the new mpox strain that has spread out of Democratic Republic of Congo say the virus is changing faster than expected and often in areas where experts lack the funding and equipment to properly track it.
articles.title: New mpox strain is changing fast; African scientists are ‘working blindly’ to respond

articles.author: Yimou Lee, Fabian Hamacher, Ann Wang, Angie Teo
articles.description: As the cage holding an endangered Formosan black bear swung open conservationists blasted gunshots and air horns to ensure the frightened young bear disappeared quickly into the mountains of central Taiwan, hopefully far from human contact.
articles.title: Hunters, conservationists join forces to protect Formosan black bear

articles.author: Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer will discuss a landmark economic and defence accord with German leaders on Wednesday, hoping to use a visit to pursue a "once-in-a-generation opportunity" to reset relations with the rest of Europe.
articles.title: UK's Starmer eyes defence deal in Germany to help reset ties with Europe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un attended the test of an upgraded 240 mm rocket launcher system, state media said on Wednesday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim attends test-firing of rocket launcher
